generif.text: Sporadic breast tumors with a "BRCA1-like" histopathological phenotype also demonstrated significantly lower frequency of HIN-1 promoter methylation.
hypermethylated in invasive and in in situ lobular breast cancer
Lack of HIN-1 methylation defines specific breast tumor subtypes including medullary carcinoma of the breast and BRCA1-linked tumors
high in normal-1 (HIN-1) is downregulated in stage I non-small cell lung cancer

silencing of HIN-1 expression and methylation of its promoter occurs in multiple human cancer types, suggesting that elimination of HIN-1 function may contribute to several forms of epithelial tumorigenesis
Aberrant methylation of HIN-1 is a frequent event in many human malignancies
Studies provide further evidence that HIN-1 possesses tumor suppressor functions, and that these activities may be mediated through the AKT signaling pathway.
CASP8, DCR2, and HIN-1 methylation leads to progression of neuroblastoma

DNA hypermethylation of tumour suppressor genes seems to play an important role in ovarian carcinogenesis and HOXA9, HOXB5, SCGB3A1, and CRABP1 are identified as novel hypermethylated target genes in this tumour type
HIN-1 was strongly associated with breast cytologic atypia. HIN-1 methylation increased rapidly between ages 32 and 40.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
HIN-1 silencing is associated with dense promoter region hypermethylation in esophageal cancer and suggest that methylation of HIN-1 is an early event in dysplastic transformation.
The combination of RARB M4, INK4a/ARF, PRB, and HIN-1 CpG island promoter methylation may predict non-BRCA1/2-associated mammary carcinogenesis and tumor progression.
Results show that cumulative RASSF1A, TWIST1, and HIN1 gene methylation accurately distinguished ducts with cancerous versus benign lesions.
The epigenetic silencing of tumor suppressor genes involved in the Ras/PI3K/AKT pathway plays an important role in oral squamous cell carcinoma radioresistance

HIN-1, RAR-beta, RASSF1A, and Twist had the ability to distinguish high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions/squamous cell carcinomas from low-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions/negative cervical scrapings

The methylation levels and frequencies of HIN1, RASSF1A and TWIST, and average MR were significantly lower in basal-like subtype compared to luminal or human epithelial growth factor receptor-2 subtype.
Hypermethylation of HIN-1 is associated with lymphatic metastasis of breast cancers.

Data suggest that high methylation of the HIN-1 promoter results in silenced HIN-1 expression in gastric cancer, and that 5-aza-2'-deoxycytidine reverses HIN-1 methylation and reduces viability of gastric cancer cells.
Data show that SCGB3A1 was down-regulated in invasive compared with DCIS, whereas talin 2 (TLN2) and PTGS1 were up-regulated in invasive compared with DCIS.
HIN1, was the most "dietary sensitive" genes, as methylation of their promoters was associated with intakes of at least two out of the eight dietary methyl factors examined.
analysis of AKT signaling pathway activated by HIN-1 methylation in non-small cell lung cancer

Methylation of HIN-1, RASSF1A, RIL and CDH13 in breast cancers was associated with clinical characteristics, but only RASSF1A methylation was associated with time to first recurrence and overall survival.
Methylation of HIN-1 promoter is a novel epigenetic biomarker associated with poor outcomes in OCCA patients.
SCGB3A1-183 T and SCGB3A1 IVS1-189 A alleles might have a protective effect against nasal polyposis.
aberrant HIN-1 promoter methylation could be an independent and important biomarker used in predicting the prognosis and progression of breast cancer
The role of high in normal-1 (HIN-1) as a potential biomarker in combating glioblastoma is being described for the first time in this study.
Tumor-adjacent tissues showed higher methylation status of RASSF1A, HIN-1 and MGMT promoters.
Some single nucleotide polymorphisms and their combinations in the Ugrp2 gene are associated with an increased risk of developing adenoid hypertrophy.
HOXA9, RASSF1A and SCGB3A1 promoter methylation significantly associated with testicular germ cell tumor stage.

name: secretoglobin family 3A member 1
summary: Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of myoblast fusion. Located in extracellular space. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
